result.execSummary:
The defendant Dorries Lataska Smith was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Adjudged Delinquent Possess Firearm, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(2)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Pay all costs, fees and surcharges including the mandatory DNA surcharge.  Collected by DOC out of up to 25% of prison funds and wages.  Any balance as a condition of ES.  If not paid, a civil judgment to be entered.
Consecutive to: Consecutive to any other sentence.

superMiscConds.notes:
Conditions of Extended Supervision to be determined by DOC, but to include those as listed:
Seek and maintain full time employment.
Mental health assessment. Comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.
No ilegal drugs.  No controlled substances without valid prescription.  No  contact with drug community.

Contact with Markeese Singleton at the probation agent's discretion.
Cognitive Behavior Therapy.
Alcohol and drug assessment. Comply with any treatment deemed necessary  by the department.  Absolute sobriety.  Random urine screens.  No positive results.

supervisions.notes:
Submit a DNA sample if not already done.
Defendant advised that he may never again possess firearms or weapons.  Civil rights suspended  until reinstated.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Dorries Lataska Smith

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Dorries Lataska Smith in court with attorney Chris Bailey.  Defendant Dorries Lataska Smith in custody.  James C Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, Defense, and Defendant.  

The Court sentenced the defendant to a TOTAL LENGTH of imprisonment of 30 months, consecutive to any other sentence.
The INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons is 15 months with credit for 75 days time served.
The Court orders the defendant to serve a maximum term of EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 15 months.

Conditions of Extended Supervision to be determined by the Dept. of Corrections, but to include:

*Mental health assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.
*Alcohol and drug assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.
*Absolute sobriety.
*Random urine screens.  No positive results.
*No illegal drugs.
*No controlled substances without valid prescription.
*No contact with drug community.
*Contact with Markeese Singleton at the Probation agent's discretion. 
*Seek and maintain full time employment.
*Cognitive Behavior Therapy.

- Defendant ordered to submit a DNA sample if not already done.
- Defendant advised that he may never again possess firearms or weapons.
- Civil rights suspended until reinstated.  Order received and filed.
- Pay all costs, fees and surcharges, including the mandatory DNA surcharge, collected by DOC out of up to 25% prison funds and wages, any balance as a condition of ES.  If not paid, a civil judgment to be entered.
- Defendant does qualify for the Challenge Incarceration Program and does qualify for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.

Appeal rights given.  
- Received and filed:  Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence; Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief; Pretrial Incarceration Credit.
Letters on behalf of the defendant, received and filed.
Letter from the defendant, filed.
Notice of Motion and Motion to Reconsider Remand, filed.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Dorries Lataska Smith in court with attorney Chris Bailey.  Katherine M Halopka-Ivery for James C. Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case calendared for final pretrial conference.  Defendant would like to enter a projected guilty plea.

Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he/she is not a US citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty. Judgment of conviction entered.  Firearms warning given.  Voting admonishment given.  DNA notification given.    Any restitution will be determined at sentencing.  PSI ordered.  Jury trial is vacated.   Defendant is REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department pending sentencing.    
  Sentencing hearing scheduled for March 2, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Dorries Lataska Smith in court with attorney Chris Bailey.  Lucy Kronforst for James C. Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case calendared for projected guilty plea hearing.  Defense counsel would like to obtain juvenile records.    Court ordered case adjourned for final pre-trial and jury trial conference in Branch 26.  Final pre-trial scheduled for January 29, 2016 at 01:30 pm.  Jury trial scheduled for March 7, 2016 at 09:00 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Per Chief Judge Directive 15-19, case is judicially transferred.

Defendant Dorries Lataska Smith in court with attorney Chris Bailey.  Defendant Dorries Lataska Smith in custody.  Ronald Dague for Randy P. Sitzberger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. 
Case is temporarily passed.

Case is recalled.
Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge Thomas McAdams, Branch 07.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference to Branch 07.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 20, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for May 20, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE POINT for Supervision.
Court orders defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY and to be monitored by drug tests and portable breathalyzers. 
Court orders no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription. 
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  
Defendant to have no contact with: Co-Defendant: Markeese Singleton
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
